intro: Silene saxifraga var. oreades, commonly known as the mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene saxifraga var. oreades is often found in open habitats such as meadows and scree slopes.
